alert.note: Alert for Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 4:11PM CST until January 24 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, Greene, Perry and Stone. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 405 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. If heavier rainfall moves into the area, a Flash Flood Warning may become necessary. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wiggins, Richton, Perkinston, Beaumont, New Augusta, McLain, Oak Grove, Janice, Barbara, Ferguson, Wingate, Mahned, Progress, Little Creek, Hintonville, Whites Crossing, Bond, McSwain, East Side and Texas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
